clinical_study.brief_title: G-Pen™ for Hypoglycemia Rescue in T1D
clinical_study.official_title: G-Pen™ (Glucagon Injection) for Induced Hypoglycemia Rescue in Adult Patients With T1D

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, exploratory pilot study in patients with T1D. The study will involve two daytime clinical research center visits 7-14 days apart. Subjects will receive a single injection of G-Pen™ (glucagon injection) at each visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with plasma glucose > 70 mg/dl at 30 minutes post-treatment
primary_outcome.description: For 90 minutes following treatment, plasma glucose with be measured every 5 minutes with an increase in plasma glucose to >70 mg/dl within 30 minutes of treatment being considered a positive response.

secondary_outcome.description: Following treatment, time in minutes required for plasma glucose to reach a concentration >70 mg/dl will be determined for each subject.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in hypoglycemia symptom scores from baseline to 30 minutes post-treatment will be assessed with a hypoglycemia symptom questionnaire.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 diabetes mellitus for at least 24 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or Lactating
- HbA1c >10.5% at screening
- Use of > 2.0 U/kg total insulin dose per day
- Inadequate bilateral venous access in both arms
- Renal insufficiency
- Congestive heart failure, NYHA class II, III or IV
- Active malignancy within 5 years from screening
- Major surgical operation within 30 days prior to screening
- Seizure or bleeding disorder
- Glycogen storage disease
- Active substance or alchohol abuse
